attributes.action:
2nd Referendum/ Public Indicative Vote :-
Leave Yes No
Leave Deal(x) Yes No
attributes.additional_details:
To represent democracy and prove a change of mind in the electorate the 2nd referendum / public indicative vote must include the original referendum question.
Options:-
Leave   Yes No
Leave No deal Yes No
Leave Mays deal Yes No
Leave Deal 1   Yes No
Leave Deal 2 Yes No and all possible options to be listed.


This will clarify the change of mind be the electorate and clarify how the public want to leave if that is still the will of the people.
attributes.background:
Politicians can not agree a way forward.
Politicians proposing a second referendum are wanting and saying that people change their minds are not prepared to put the original Leave question to the electorate, but to give a choice between Mays deal or remain. This does not confirm a change of mind.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. In particular, we're not sure what you mean by the referendum options "Leave Deal 1" and "Leave Deal 2".

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

There are already petitions about a second EU referendum. You might like to sign this petition if it calls for something you'd like to happen. You're more likely to get action on an issue if you sign and share a single petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/253709
